params._avatar: address for which the short name is to be calculated
params._nonce: nonce to be used in the calculation

isValidName(string).details: checks whether string is a valid name by checking the length as max 32 bytes and the allowed characters: 0-9, A-Z, a-z, space, hyphen, underscore, period, parentheses, apostrophe, ampersand, plus and hash. This restricts the contract name to a subset of ASCII characters, and excludes unicode characters for other alphabets and emoticons. Instead the default ERC1155 metadata read from the IPFS CID registry, should provide the full display name with unicode characters. Names are not checked for uniqueness.

isValidSymbol(string).details: checks whether string is a valid symbol by checking the length as max 16 bytes and the allowed characters: 0-9, A-Z, a-z, hyphen, underscore.

params._nonce: nonce to be used in the calculation

params._avatar: address for which the name is to be calculated

returns.nonce_: nonce for which this name can be assigned
returns.shortName_: short name that can be assigned to the avatar

DEFAULT_CIRCLES_NAME_PREFIX().notice: The default name prefix for Circles

MAX_SHORT_NAME().notice: The last ("biggest") short name that can be assigned is "zzzzzzzzzzzz", which is 1449225352009601191935 in decimal when converted from base58

avatarToMetaDataDigest(address).notice: avatarToMetaDataDigest is a mapping of avatar to the sha256 digest of their latest ERC1155 metadata.

calculateShortNameWithNonce(address,uint.notice: Calculates a short name for the avatar using a nonce

hub().notice: The address of the hub contract where the address must have registered first

registerShortName().notice: Register a short name for the avatar

registerShortNameWithNonce(uint256).notice: Registers a short name for the avatar using a specific nonce if the short name is available

searchShortName(address).notice: Search for the first available short name for the avatar and return the short name and nonce

shortNameToAvatar(uint72).notice: a mapping from the short name to the address

shortNames(address).notice: a mapping from the avatar address to the assigned name
